candidates.title: fix: actix integration with state
candidates.body: The actix integration was not compatible with shared state (PgPool does not implement copy), so I removed the Copy bound. Added example in https://github.com/shuttle-hq/examples/pull/8

candidates.title: feat: build tests in release profile, limit build workers
candidates.body:
This limits the workers used by `cargo build` to 8 for deployments, reducing memory usage during deployments while still keeping build times low. 

It also set tests that are ran after building a project for deployment to build in the release profile, this means that this step doesn't have to recompile the crates in the debug profile for testing.

candidates.title: refactor: switch away from cargo package
feat: implement workspace inheritance
candidates.body: This implements the new workspace inheritance feature from 1.64. For this PR I elected to just add some external crates to the workspace dependencies, since `cargo-chef` does not support local crate workspace deps yet. When it does, we can add more. I'm happy to add more external deps to this PR, but it should also be easy to do as part of other PRs as we see commonly used deps that aren't inherited.

candidates.title: feat: bump pinned rust version to 1.65
candidates.body: Due to the error in CI on the first commit of this PR (`E: Unable to locate package protobuf-compiler`), I ended up backporting the updated protoc install command from shuttle-next.

candidates.title: Add spinner wait for `project new` and `project status --follow`
candidates.body:
- feat: Wait env ready after `project new`
- feat: Add --follow argument to `project status` command
- refactor: Remove unused reference
- refactor: Unify in same function the code for wait with spinner

This PR closes #492

candidates.title: feat: static file support for a single folder
feat: interactive project initialization
candidates.body:
PR for #493.

All the functionality should be there. However, when it came to writing tests, I noticed that the current integration test setup can't really test stdin/stdout. I think we'd have to call it as a standalone program to do so. Does anyone have any thoughts on that? ~I'm happy to try and change it to such a setup tomorrow.~ Edit: I've added some tests with that sort of setup now.

cc @oddgrd @brokad

candidates.title: feat: bump rust to 1.64, bump dependencies
candidates.body:
Bump the pinned rust version of containers to 1.64, and update dependencies. I wasn't able to bump `cargo` from 0.64 to 0.66, as it has some conflict over libgit2-sys with `cargo-edit`. I bumped everything else, most of it did not require code changes, except for configuring the timeout for the aws sdk in provisioner and general axum changes. These code changes are in separate commits.

I did not upgrade clap to 0.4 in provisioner, deployer and cargo-shuttle, this might be better to do in a separate PR.

This branch is set to use the updated examples from this branch: https://github.com/shuttle-hq/examples/pull/4, since quite a few of the frameworks will have incompatible version with the current ones in examples `main`. 

Another thing to note is that this PR upgrades our pinned tokio to 1.22, which works with all the updated frameworks. This, and updating the framework versions, means users will be forced to upgrade as well. 

Note: ~I'm not sure why the latest CI run segfaulted, it seems to only use tokio 1.22 and it passes locally.~ Edit: after ignoring the actix test (which is missing an example currently), the CI fails in a normal fashion.

Closes #425

candidates.title: Feature/support actix web
candidates.body:
#205 
implementation of Service for actix-web using [configure method](https://actix.rs/docs/application)
[Example](https://github.com/biryukovmaxim/shuttle-examples/tree/feature/actix-web-example/actix-web/hello-world)

I have no idea how to fix this error

candidates.title: fix: backend bumps and hot fixes
feat: restore removed containers
candidates.body:
This
- Expands the default subnet to `/16`
- Has gateway re-create containers that have disappeared if they used to be ready, keeping the same image and fqdn as before

candidates.title: ci: green
candidates.body: The CI is a bit slow to build the test crates, so giving it a bit more time

candidates.title: Feat(shuttle-next): stop runtime services
candidates.body:
Add a stop method to `runtime.proto`. We can't currently stop services on the legacy runtime, since we can't actually drop the legacy runtime. I implemented a stop method for it before discovering it was not possible, I left it there but with a comment. I'm happy to replace it with a `todo!()` if that's more tidy for now. 

I implemented stop for wasm serenity and axum, which is tested (manually) and works. We may want to setup integration tests for these runtimes with some helpers for the grpc requests, but maybe in a separate PR?

I opted for `oneshot` channels that are set on each `start`, but on second thought it may have been a mistake. I suppose the runtime should be able to load -> start several services, keeping them all alive until their ID/name receives a stop request. Meaning `broadcast` channels may be the correct choice here.

Note: This PR also changes the Dockerfile to install a newer protoc binary directly, rather than with `apt`, to allow us to use explicit optional fields in the protobufs. This is also done for the CI.

candidates.title: feat: add a custom domains admin route
[WIP] feat(shuttle-next): POC of axum wasm router
candidates.body: This is an experimental PR to test out ways to interact with an axum wasm app. A hyper server is started in the runtime on load -> start request, that serves a wasm axum router linked to the runtime with WASI. Request parts are serialized as rmp and passed through along with the body (slice of bytes) to the router as file descriptors, and vice versa.

shuttle next wrapper POC
candidates.body:
This adds a new binary to the workspace: `shuttle-next` (name TBD). It takes a path to an .so file to load, loads and runs it.

```bash
RUST_LOG=trace cargo run --bin shuttle-next -- -f <path to .so file>
```
